anxiety.message: I understand you're feeling anxious. Let's try a simple breathing exercise together: breathe in for 4 counts, hold for 7, and exhale for 8. This can help calm your nervous system.
activities: Practice the 4-7-8 breathing technique
Take a short walk outside
Listen to calming music
Write down your worries and challenge them
resources: Anxiety and Depression Association of America: https://adaa.org

depression.message: I hear that you're going through a difficult time. Your feelings are valid, and it's okay to not be okay. Remember that this feeling isn't permanent, and there are people who want to help.
activities: Take a small step outside today
Start a gratitude journal
Reach out to a friend or family member
Do one small act of self-care

crisis.message: I'm very concerned about your safety right now. Your life has value and there are people who want to help. If you're having thoughts of self-harm or suicide, please reach out to emergency services immediately:
activities: 🚨 Call emergency services (911) if you're in immediate danger
📞 Contact a trusted friend or family member right now
💬 Stay on the line with a crisis counselor
🏥 Go to the nearest emergency room if you feel unsafe
resources: Crisis Text Line: Text HOME to 741741

loneliness.message: Feeling lonely can be really painful, and I want you to know that your feelings are valid. Even though I'm just a chatbot, I'm here to listen.
activities: 🤝 Join a local community group or club
📱 Reach out to an old friend
🐕 Consider volunteering at an animal shelter
📚 Join a book club or online community

stress.message: I understand that you're feeling stressed. Stress can feel overwhelming, but there are ways to manage it. Let's take a moment to focus on your breathing and identify what's within your control.
activities: Practice deep breathing exercises
Try a 5-minute meditation
Write down your stressors and possible solutions
Take a short break and stretch
Prioritize your tasks and break them into smaller steps
resources: American Psychological Association Stress Management: https://www.apa.org/topics/stress

sleep.message: Sleep difficulties can really impact our mental well-being. I hear that you're struggling with this. Would you like to explore some gentle bedtime routine suggestions that might help you wind down?
activities: 🌙 Establish a consistent bedtime routine
📱 Reduce screen time before bed
🧘‍♀️ Try relaxation techniques
📝 Keep a sleep journal

self_esteem.message: I hear that you're struggling with self-doubt. Your worth isn't determined by any single aspect of your life. What's one thing you're proud of, no matter how small it might seem?
activities: 💡 Write down three things you like about yourself
🎭 Try positive affirmations every morning
📓 Keep a journal of your achievements, even the small ones
🤗 Avoid comparing yourself to others online

panic_attack.message: I'm here for you. I know panic attacks can be really overwhelming, but remember: this will pass. Let's take a deep breath together.
activities: 🫁 Try the 5-4-3-2-1 grounding technique
🧘‍♂️ Practice deep breathing exercises
🎶 Listen to calming music
💧 Drink a glass of cold water
resources: Anxiety and Depression Association of America - www.adaa.org

burnout.message: It sounds like you've been pushing yourself really hard. Burnout can make even the simplest things feel exhausting. You deserve rest and recovery.
activities: ☕ Take regular breaks throughout the day
💤 Prioritize sleep and self-care
🎧 Listen to relaxing music or podcasts
📅 Set realistic goals and boundaries

grief.message: I'm so deeply sorry for your loss. Losing someone we love creates a profound emptiness that words can't fully capture. Please know that your grief is a reflection of the love you shared, and there's no 'right' way to feel during this time. Whether you want to talk about your loved one or just sit with these feelings, I'm here to listen.
activities: Create a memory box with photos and mementos
Write a letter to your loved one expressing your feelings
Light a candle or visit a meaningful place in their memory
Share stories and memories with family or friends
Join a grief support group to connect with others who understand
Practice gentle self-care - it's okay to take things day by day
Consider starting a journal to process your emotions
resources: What's Your Grief - Support & Resources: https://whatsyourgrief.com
GriefShare - Find Local Support Groups: https://www.griefshare.org
Crisis Text Line (24/7): Text HOME to 741741

study_difficulties.message: I understand you're having difficulties with your studies. Academic challenges can be overwhelming, but we can work through this together. Let's break down what's troubling you and find some strategies to help.
activities: 📝 Break tasks into smaller, manageable chunks
⏰ Try the Pomodoro technique (25 minutes study, 5 minutes break)
🧘‍♀️ Take regular breaks to maintain focus
📚 Create a distraction-free study environment
📋 Make a study schedule with realistic goals
🤝 Consider forming a study group
💡 Try different study methods to find what works best for you
resources: Khan Academy - Free Online Courses: www.khanacademy.org
Academic Support Services at your institution

focus_issues.message: I understand that maintaining focus can be challenging. Let's explore what might be affecting your concentration.
activities: 🧘‍♀️ Try the 5-4-3-2-1 grounding technique
⏰ Use the Pomodoro technique for focused work periods
📝 Make a to-do list and prioritize tasks
🌳 Take short breaks to clear your mind

anger.message: I hear your frustration. Anger is a natural emotion, and it's okay to feel it. Let's work on finding healthy ways to express and manage these feelings.
activities: Take a timeout and count to 10
Write down what triggered your anger
Practice deep breathing
Go for a brisk walk
Try progressive muscle relaxation
resources: American Psychological Association Anger Management: https://www.apa.org/topics/anger

relationship.message: I understand you're going through a difficult breakup. It's completely normal to feel hurt and overwhelmed during this time. Healing takes time, and it's okay to take things one day at a time.
activities: Write a letter expressing your feelings (but don't send it)
Spend time with friends who support you
Focus on self-care activities you enjoy
Try a new hobby or activity
Create a playlist of empowering songs

study.message: I understand you're having difficulty with studying. Academic challenges can feel overwhelming, but let's break this down into manageable steps. Remember that everyone faces study difficulties at times, and there are effective strategies that can help you regain focus and confidence.
activities: Use the Pomodoro Technique: 25 minutes study, 5 minutes break
Create a structured study schedule with specific goals
Find a quiet, dedicated study space
Try active recall instead of passive reading (flashcards, practice tests)
Use mind mapping to organize complex topics
Take regular breaks and get enough sleep
Join or form a study group for motivation and support
Break large tasks into smaller, manageable chunks
Experiment with different learning styles (visual, auditory, kinesthetic)
resources: Khan Academy - Free Educational Resources: https://www.khanacademy.org

study_grief.message: I hear that you're trying to manage your studies while dealing with grief. This is an incredibly challenging situation, and it's completely normal to struggle with focusing on academics during this time. Please know that many schools have support systems in place for students going through loss.
activities: 🎓 Contact your academic advisor about possible accommodations
📝 Break study sessions into very small, manageable chunks
🧘‍♀️ Take mindful breaks when grief feels overwhelming
📚 Find a quiet, comfortable space for studying
🤝 Consider joining a grief support group
💭 Allow yourself grace and patience with academic progress
📋 Keep a journal to track both your grief and study journey
resources: Student Counseling Services at your institution
Academic Support Services for special circumstances
The Dougy Center - Grief Resources: www.dougy.org
Study Skills During Difficult Times: www.studygs.net/managing.htm

general.message: I'm here to listen and support you. Sometimes just having someone to talk to can help. Feel free to share what's on your mind - whether it's big or small, your feelings matter.
activities: 🧘‍♀️ Take a few deep breaths together
📝 Write down your thoughts and feelings
🌳 Go for a short mindful walk
🎵 Listen to calming music
💭 Practice self-compassion exercises
☕ Have a relaxing cup of tea or water
🌅 Take a moment to pause and reset
